model

Class Scheduler<N extends Process>

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Scheduler<N>
  • Type Parameters:
    N - A subclass of process which is used by this algorithm
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CalcAverages<N>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FIFO, Priority, RoundRobin, SJF, SRT

    public abstract class Scheduler<N extends Process>
extends Object
implements CalcAverages<N>
    * Super class of all CPU Scheduling algorithms with common variables and methods. This is an abstract class and should be used accordingly.
    Author:
    Peter Vukas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Gantt gantt
      A gantt chart generated during run()

    • Field Detail

      • gantt

        public final Gantt gantt
        A gantt chart generated during run()

    • Method Detail

      • getAverageWaitTime

        public double getAverageWaitTime()
        Returns:
        Average wait time if it's been calculated. Otherwise, it will return a -1 if a successful calculation did not occur.

      • getAverageTurnAroundTime

        public double getAverageTurnAroundTime()
        Returns:
        Average turn around time if it's been calculated. Otherwise, it will return a -1 if a successful calculation did not occur.

      • clearProcesses

        public void clearProcesses()
        Removes ALL processes from the current list. This cannot be undone.

      • showAlert

        @Deprecated
public void showAlert()
        Deprecated. 
        Show the alert and allow the user to stop the "CPU" from running

      • getProcesses

        public abstract ArrayList<N> getProcesses()
        Returns:
        A deep copied list of all processes which can be changed without issue to this scheduler algorithm

      • addProcess

        public abstract void addProcess(N p)
        Parameters:
        p - A Process to be added to the list of processes to run

      • removeProcess

        public abstract boolean removeProcess(N p)
        Parameters:
        p - The process to be removed from the list of processes to run
        Returns:
        True if the process was found and removed.

      • populateProcessList

        public abstract void populateProcessList(int size)
        Populates the process list with auto generated processes.
        Parameters:
        size - An integer > 0 representing the amount of generated processes desired. If this value is <= 0, it will be replaced with 10.

      • run

        public abstract ArrayList<N> run()
        The algorithm which determines the order in which processes are run
        Returns:
        An array list with the order of processes running
